column4: umm Can someone help me... I got an Error when I tried to update my repository indexes
if the server is currently unavailable it's nothing one can do
no. you just can't install stuff from that repo
is there a way for me to remove them
remove WHAT?
edit your sources.list but I wouldn't
Thats how I got this in the first place ... I went of a web site copy and pasted
and that was wrong for medibuntu
So I have to Delete and reinstall it remove the lines from my list?
reinstall?
ya Ubuntu ... to remove the  the links from my  sources.list. so I can stop those error's
you don't reinstall. this is not windows

I;m new to Ubuntu ... switching from Mandriva .. so Let see So I have to debug my hard drive ... and then Gpart my hard drive to ext3 and then reinstall Unbuntu with the 8.04 iso  and made  to get rid of this error code?
none of it
only edit your sources.list
but as I already told you I wouldn't do that
I don't know how ....
with a nice editor
and it's not any problematic error at all
will I need root?
yes
rather: sudo or gksu
I've never gotten root ... other than the sudo in ubuntu ... in Mandriva I just did su or went in to the gui
sudo is all you need. for this too. or gksu if using the gui
